name: 2-of-2 Recoverable Vault
description:
A 2-of-2 wallet, which after a specified delay, can be recovered by either of the original two keys and a signature from a trusted user (e.g. an attorney).

In this implementation, all wallet addresses become recoverable at the same time. To "bump" the recovery time to a later date, create a new wallet and transfer the funds.

This scheme is described in more detail in BIP-65.

signer_1.description: One of the two co-owners of this wallet. If Signer 1 is unable to sign, Signer 2 and Trusted Party can recover funds after the specified delay.
signer_1.name: Signer 1

delay_seconds.description: The waiting period (from the time the wallet is created) after which the Trusted Party can assist with delayed recoveries. The delay is measured in seconds, e.g. 1 day is 86400, 30 days is 2592000.
delay_seconds.name: Recovery Delay (Seconds)

signer_2.description: One of the two co-owners of this wallet. If Signer 2 is unable to sign, Signer 1 and Trusted Party can recover funds after the specified delay.
signer_2.name: Signer 2

trusted_party.description: A trusted party, like a lawyer or trusted employee. If either signer is unable to sign, after the specified delay, Trusted Party can help to recover funds by co-signing on that signer's behalf.
trusted_party.name: Trusted Party

after_recovery_time.description: An example of a time after the recovery delay has passed.
after_recovery_time.name: After Recovery Time

before_recovery_time.description: An example of a time before a 30 day recovery delay (2592000 seconds) has passed.
before_recovery_time.name: Before Recovery Time

lock.name: 2-of-2 Recoverable Vault
lock.script:
OP_IF
  <$(
    <current_block_time> <delay_seconds>
    OP_ADD
  )>
  OP_CHECKLOCKTIMEVERIFY OP_DROP
  <trusted.public_key>
  OP_CHECKSIGVERIFY
  <1>
OP_ELSE
  <2>
OP_ENDIF
<first.public_key> <second.public_key> <2>
OP_CHECKMULTISIG
